reviews.review_msg: I love his teaching style. He offers so many extra interesting ideas/pieces of literature that not only help with your writing but your critical thinking. A lot of people put stress on the fact that his instructions are not direct but that is the point; he is trying to give us freedom in what we write. To me, this was great and I enjoyed writing.
At first I hated him, but in retrospect he's quite good.  He's very smart, eloquent, and although he's a bit of a **** with marks, overall taking a course with him is probably good in the long run.

Because of him, I will never take another rhetoric class again.  I'm a speech-writer, a scholarship student, and a smart guy, so I know it's not just me.  I really hope he reads this, so he knows there's someone out there who despises him.  (Maybe he'll become a better teacher.)

I can't begin to describe how much I detest this class.  Perhaps it's simply because I don't think like a rhetorician, but there's no way I can just read the book, go to lecture to hear more of the same, and ace the material.  Can't say if he's good for you, but if he's not...get out of his class fast.

a little dry, but he does his best. very knowledgeable and accessible outside of class. he does talk a lot tho. he didn't let me have an extension after my dad died bc of the course policy, which rlly messed with my head, but i guess i can understand.

Dry, but not a bad professor. The lectures are 3 hours long, and most of class is based on discussion on concepts that are difficult to understand sometimes. His rubrics are extremely vague and difficult to adhere to.

Dr. Cramer is a wonderful professor who listens to his student's concerns and welcomes questions about course material. Take a rhetoric class with him if you can! It is super useful for future English classes and 3 hour seminars are fun as long as you make an effort to participate.

214 had very dry readings and lectures could be quite boring and lengthy. However, I feel this course was very helpful and I learned a lot. Would definitely take again. Peter is a fair marker and kind to his students. Doing the readings before class and participating is a must.

Peter has a great teaching style that really encourages you to participate in order to learn.  The material can be quite difficult to grasp at times, but he goes in depth and makes sure you really understand it.  He's a genuinely nice guy too and really seems to care about his students.

Peter definitely has an interest in Rhetoric and engages in his lectures with it. Some of it can be  dry if you aren't very interested in it, but he's all-in-all great. Papers are weird to write at first, it's definitely a learning experience; concision is required like in Philosophy. Two fair papers and a mid-term with NO final, which is great.
